text:
Congratulations  on finishing  your diploma. Well done !
Sorry but I don't  have much idea about  runners roles or apprenticeships.  But I did just see that mpc are looking for summer  runners support and you might want to check the other big studios  sites. Get in quick  though,  I think the might  go fast. 
Let me know what luck  you have.
I'll make sure to keep you updated

Do you think that it's always necessary to have a degree in animation etc to be hired for a job? I've seen my classmates produce spectacular work in college, and some already work. Do you see most of your colleagues coming in from their related degrees?

Some  do have degrees  for sure. I don't  have a degree  but did a one year postgraduate course. It's  all about the quality  and imagination in your work when it comes to animation. Then once y OJ u get an interview it's about your attitude and personality. 
Most people who I know that did a degree  in animation  say it was a waste of their  time ( apart from friends and contacts they gained) , many  learned how to animate at a course like animation mentor etc, or on the job .
If you know animation is for you ( which most don't realise until half way into a more general course) then I would say either do a degree  and focus purely on animation  or do an online animation diploma. The teachers are amazing  sometimes and you learn so much more than most universities.
